Lisa Su

One of the World's Best CEOs of 2019

Career:

  • 1994-1999: Texas Instruments and IBM R&D

    • n June 1994, Su became a member of the technical staff at Texas Instruments, working in the company's Semiconductor Process and Device Center (SPDC) until February 1995.

  • 2000-2007: IBM Emerging Products division

    • n 2000, Su was given a year-long assignment as the technical assistant for Lou Gerstner, IBM's CEO. She subsequently took on the role of director of emerging projects, stating that "I was basically director of myself â€“ there was no one else in the group".

  • 2007-2011: Freescale Semiconductor

    • Su joined Freescale Semiconductor in June 2007 as chief technology officer (CTO), heading the company's research and development until August 2009.

  • 2012-2014: AMD appointments

    • Su became senior vice president and general manager at Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) in January 2012, overseeing the company's global business units and the "end-to-end business execution" of AMD's products.

  • 2015-2016: AMD diversification

    • When Su joined AMD in 2012, about 10 percent of sales came from non-PC products. By February 2015, roughly 40 percent of AMD's sales came from non-PC markets, such as video game consoles and embedded devices.

  • 2017-present: Ryzen

    • After the initial launch of Zen chips in quarter two 2017, AMD's percentage of the CPU market share surged to nearly 11%.
